triageFlags.title: Excessive Debt-to-Income Ratio
triageFlags.description: The applicant's Debt-to-Income ratio is significantly above the allowable threshold for their credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the application due to affordability concerns.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the policy, the maximum DTI for Tier B applicants is 40%. The applicant's DTI of 440% indicates a severe affordability issue, making the proposal unviable.

content.reasoning: The applicant's DTI ratio is 440%, far exceeding the maximum allowable threshold of 40% for their credit tier. This indicates a severe affordability issue, making the proposal unviable under current policy guidelines.
